section.section: The Board consists of 12 members, 11 of whom shall be appointed by the Governor with the advice of the Secretary.
The Secretary, or the Secretary's designee, shall serve as an ex officio member of the Board.

text.section: Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 4 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on July 1, 1980.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetency or misconduct.
